required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase I Study of SHR-2002 + SHR-1316 in Patients With Advanced Malignant Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Clinical Study on the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Preliminary Efficacy of SHR-2002 Injection in Combination With SHR-1316 in Patients With Advanced Malignant Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This is Phase 1 study FIH to check "Dose Escalation, Dose expansion and Indication expansion". This study is AUSTRALIA only study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to study completion, an average of 2 years
primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with adverse events (AEs)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants experiencing Dose-Limiting Toxicities (DLTs)
primary_outcome.description: According to National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events Version 5.0 (NCI-CTCAE v.5.0)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after SHR-2002 and SHR-1316 infusion throughout the study, an average of 2 years
Before and after SHR-2002 and SHR-1316 infusion throughout the study, an average of 2 years
Before and after SHR-2002 and SHR-1316 infusion throughout the study, an average of 2 years

arm_group.description: Dose expansion of SHR-2002 will be decided after finishing few cohorts in Dose escalation part.
Indication expansion of SHR-2002 will be decided after finishing few cohorts in Dose expansion part.
